ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My oral Spanish skills improved and I learn more about different aspects of Latino culture.
I improved my written Spanish a lot, and Jorge offered feedback everywhere it was needed.

Not only did I better my spanish, but I was also able to just learn so much more about Latin American culture in general. We focused on amplifying the voices of different minority groups in Latin America, something I haven't really done in other classes.
This course taught me a lot about Hispanic culture and introduced fascinating subjects that encompassed race, myth, and identity.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The instructor was really, really great; he was engaging, enthusiastic and thorough. I cannot think of any improvements.

I like that SPAN 140, compared to SPAN 110-130, does not require any $100+ purchases of students. Also, it was useful to see writing in context rather than memorizing numerous facts each week. I wish that I improved my spoken Spanish more, but I think studying abroad would help with that!

Strengths: not vocab and grammar based; there was room to learn more about culture
Weaknesses: i honestly can't think of any
The strengths of the course were its organization, diversity in terms of topic, and the feedback that allows students to progress.
The professor was very engaged and he didnt assign busy work which was good.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would, largely thanks to the lecturer Jorge.
Yes, especially with Jorge. He is one of the most organized professors I've had for Spanish. I always knew what I was supposed to work on.
YES, especially with Jorge. The usual L4 stuff is just so much better and taught with more depth.
I would definitely recommend this course.
Yes I would recommend the professor more so than the class
